required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Music in Reducing Pain During Outpatient Hysteroscopy in Primarily Infertile Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Music in Reducing Pain During Outpatient Hysteroscopy in Primarily Infertile Patients: Prospective Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to demonstrate the value of music in outpatient hysteroscopy on patients' level of pain and satisfaction in primarily infertile patients.

primary_outcome.description: Pain intensity will be assessed by visual analogue scale during the procedure.visual analogue scale ranging from 0 to 10

secondary_outcome.description: Pain intensity will be assessed by visual analogue scale 30 minutes after the procedure.visual analogue scale ranging from 0 to 10
satisfaction will be assessed by visual analogue scale-like scale ranging from 0 to 10 (0=no satisfaction; 10=maximal satisfaction)

arm_group.description: In the music group, music chosen by the participant will be played through a speaker by the nursing staff during outpatient hysteroscopy. Music will be played through a speaker instead of headphones in order to maintain good communication and interaction between the participant and the doctor.
Participants in the non-music group will undergo outpatient hysteroscopy in the same setting and standard procedure without listening to any music.

intervention.description: In the music group, music chosen by the participant will be played through a speaker by the nursing staff during outpatient hysteroscopy. Music will be played through a speaker instead of headphones in order to maintain good communication and interaction between the participant and the doctor.
Participants in the non-music group will undergo outpatient hysteroscopy in the same setting and standard procedure without listening to any music.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- women with primary infertility requiring a diagnostic hysteroscopy as a part of an infertility diagnosis workup
Exclusion Criteria:
- women with suspected pregnancy
heavy vaginal bleeding recent pelvic infection those who received analgesics prior to OH a concomitant neurologic disease that could affect the correct evaluation of pain

responsible_party.investigator_title: assistant professor of obstetrics and gynecology
